intro: Crypsinus wrayi, commonly known as the Wray's crypton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
